appearances.snippet: we spoke with east bay congressman mark desaulnier earlier for more insight on what might move the needle on the bill. >> i think the american public, all the polling we see is this is one of their biggest priorities is health care. they know from family members and loved ones and from the news that doesn't work for them. and it's getting worse. so just the public pressure, i think, is where i'm optimistic. >> congressman desaulnier also says he spoke with colleagues in the senate about their efforts on the bill, and they say they are close to a bipartisan deal. >> our time is 548. a christian legal group is challenging a california law that allows schools to keep a student's gender identity a secret from their parents. the thomas more law center filed an emergency appeal with the supreme court, urging the court to reinstate a judge's ruling last year that allowed parents with religious objections to opt out of the law's stipulations. now, the group is arguing the law violates the parents religious rights. the law was signed by governor newsom back in 2024. supporters say it protects tran

appearances.snippet: earlier today, we spoke with east bay congressman mark desaulnier for more insight on the health care bill. >> it was real accomplishment. it was interesting how determined their leadership in the white house was not to have this happen. and it just got momentum, sort of like the epstein files where more republicans joined in. for us to extend it. having said that, we've got a lot of work to do. the health care system in the united states needs a lot of work. and i've been urging my colleagues on the other side, let's work together. >> congressman desaulnier also says he has spoken with colleagues in the senate about their efforts, and they say they're close to a bipartisan deal. five days after u.s. special forces captured venezuela's leader nicolas maduro without notifying congress, five republicans joined democratic senators on a test vote to support a war powers resolution restricting further military action in the region. lawmakers briefed by the pentagon were told there are currently no u.s. troops in venezuela, but u.s. ships and personnel will remain in the caribbean and surro
